sen.j: 森 成利（もり なりとし）は、戦国時代 (日本)の武将。
sen.e: Naritoshi MORI was a busho (Japanese military commander) of the Sengoku Period (Warring States Period).
Naritoshi MORI was a busho (Japanese military commander) of the Sengoku period (period of warring states).
sen.cmt: the Sengoku period (period of warring states)に訂正しました。不要なスペースを削除しました。
sen.e: Naritoshi MORI was a busho (Japanese military commander) of the Sengoku period (period of warring states).

sen.j: 現在では森 蘭丸（もり らんまる）という名で知られている。
sen.e: Today he is known by the name of Ranmaru MORI.
Today he is known by the name of Ranmaru MORI.
sen.cmt: 不要なスペースを削除しました。
sen.e: Today he is known by the name of Ranmaru MORI.

sen.j: 本姓は源氏。
sen.e: He was descended from a branch of the Minamoto (Genji) clan.
He was descended from a branch of the Minamoto clan.
He was descended from a branch of the Minamoto clan.

sen.j: 家系は清和源氏のひとつ河内源氏の棟梁 源義家の七男（六男とも）源義隆を祖とする森氏。
sen.e: His lineage can be traced back to the Mori clan, whose ancestor is MINAMOTO no Yoshitaka, a seventh (or sixth) son of MINAMOTO no Yoshiie, who was the head of the Kawachi-Genji, one of the branches of the Seiwa-Genji.

His lineage can be traced back to the Mori clan, whose ancestor is MINAMOTO no Yoshitaka, a seventh (or sixth) son of MINAMOTO no Yoshiie, who was the head of the Kawachi-Genji (Minamoto clan), one of the branches of the Seiwa-Genji (Minamoto clan).
sen.cmt: 不要なスペースを削除しました。(Minamoto clan)補足しました。
sen.e: His lineage can be traced back to the Mori clan, whose ancestor is MINAMOTO no Yoshitaka, a seventh (or sixth) son of MINAMOTO no Yoshiie, who was the head of the Kawachi-Genji (Minamoto clan), one of the branches of the Seiwa-Genji (Minamoto clan).

sen.j: 父は織田信長の家臣・森可成。
sen.e: His father was Yoshinari MORI, a vassal of Nobunaga ODA.
His father was Yoshinari MORI, a vassal of Nobunaga ODA.
sen.cmt: 不要なスペースを削除しました。
sen.e: His father was Yoshinari MORI, a vassal of Nobunaga ODA.

sen.j: 兄に森可隆、森長可、弟に森長隆、森長氏、森忠政（後の津山藩初代藩主）らがいる。
sen.e: He had older brothers, Yoshitaka MORI and Nagayoshi MORI, and younger brothers, Nagataka MORI, Nagauji MORI and Tadamasa MORI (who later became the first lord of the Tsuyama Domain).
He had older brothers, Yoshitaka MORI and Nagayoshi MORI, and younger brothers, Nagataka MORI, Nagauji MORI and Tadamasa MORI (who later became the first lord of the Tsuyama Domain).
He had older brothers, Yoshitaka MORI and Nagayoshi MORI, and younger brothers, Nagataka MORI, Nagauji MORI and Tadamasa MORI (who later became the first lord of the Tsuyama Domain).

sen.j: 尾張国出身の大名織田信長に小姓として寵愛を受けたとされ、信長と衆道の関係にあったとされる。
sen.e: He was said to have been a favorite pageboy of Nobunaga ODA, who was from Owari Province, and to have had a sexual relationship with Nobunaga.
He was said to have been a favorite pageboy of Nobunaga ODA, who was from Owari Province, and to have had a sexual relationship with Nobunaga.
He was said to have been a favorite pageboy of Nobunaga ODA, who was from Owari Province, and to have had a sexual relationship with Nobunaga.

sen.j: そのため、稚児・児小姓として信長に優遇されたとの俗説が広く流布している。
sen.e: It is a widely-held popular belief that he was treated well by Nobunaga as a page because of the relationship.
It is a widely-held popular belief that he was treated well by Nobunaga as a page because of the relationship.
It is a widely-held popular belief that he was treated well by Nobunaga as a page because of the relationship.

sen.j: が他方、幼少の子息を残して戦死した部将（父の森可成）に代わり、主君の信長が養父の役割をしただけであるとの意見もある。
sen.e: On the other hand, some say Lord Nobunaga merely took a role as his foster father, in place of a commanding officer (his father Yoshinari MORI) who died in a battle, leaving young sons.
sen.cmt: 原文の「部将」は、正しくは「武将」と思われます。
sen.e: On the other hand, some say Lord Nobunaga merely took a role as his foster father, in place of a commanding officer (his father Yoshinari MORI) who died in a battle, leaving young sons.
On the other hand, some say Lord Nobunaga merely took a role as his foster father, in place of a commanding officer (his father Yoshinari MORI) who died in a battle, leaving young sons.

sen.j: 家中での諸取次、者奏、諸事奉行、加判奉行等を努めた、有能かつ前途有望な若い事務官であった。
sen.e: He was a capable, promising young administrative official who served Nobunaga and the family, by informing visitor arrivals and mediating messages, reports, or imperial grants as a toritsugi or soushaban attendant, and by handling signatory work and various matters as a bugyo (magistrate).

He was a capable, promising young administrative official who served Nobunaga and the family, by informing visitor arrivals and mediating messages, reports, or imperial grants as a toritsugi or soushaban attendant, and by handling signatory work and various matters as a bugyo (magistrate).

He was a capable, promising young administrative official who served Nobunaga and the family, by informing visitor arrivals and mediating messages, reports, or imperial grants as a toritsugi or soushaban attendant, and by handling signatory work and various matters as a bugyo (magistrate).

sen.j: 現代においては「信長の寵愛した近習といえばまず第一に森蘭丸」と思われがちだが、当時の諸国や畿内政界においては「森乱」はまだまだ認知されておらず、大きな仕事も任されてはいない。
sen.e: Today people tend to think, "When Nobunaga's favorite kinshu (attendant) is mentioned, first comes Ranmaru MORI."; however, in those days "Mori Ran" had not yet been acknowledged within various districts nor the Kinai region (provinces surrounding Kyoto and Nara), nor had he been given any big assignment.

Today people tend to think that 'when Nobunaga's favorite kinshu (attendant) is mentioned, first comes Ranmaru MORI who also known as 'Mori Ran''; however, in those days he had not yet been acknowledged within various districts nor the Kinai region (provinces surrounding Kyoto and Nara), nor had he been given any big assignment.
sen.cmt: 原文の「」に合せて"を'に訂正しました。文中のピリオドを削除しました。コンマを削除し、that補足しました。who also known as 'Mori Ran'補足しました。heに訂正しました。
sen.e: Today people tend to think that 'when Nobunaga's favorite kinshu (attendant) is mentioned, first comes Ranmaru MORI who also known as 'Mori Ran''; however, in those days he had not yet been acknowledged within various districts nor the Kinai region (provinces surrounding Kyoto and Nara), nor had he been given any big assignment.

sen.j: 近習として活躍した期間もたったの2年ほどでしかない。
sen.e: Even as a kinshu, he was active only for two years.
Even as a kinshu, he was active only for two years.
Even as a kinshu, he was active only for two years.

sen.j: そもそも、死亡時点（本能寺の変）でも十八・九歳である。
sen.e: After all, he was only eighteen or nineteen years old at the time of death (in the Honnoji Incident).
After all, he was only 18 or 19 years old at the time of death (in the Honnoji Incident).
After all, he was only 18 or 19 years old at the time of death (in the Honnoji Incident).

sen.j: 「森蘭丸」の逸話には、他の人物や古典との類似が見られ、江戸時代以降の創作および大名森家による宣伝が指摘されている。
sen.e: The anecdote about "Ranmaru MORI" shows similarities to stories about other people and classical literature, and so some point out that it is a fiction created after the Edo period as well as a propaganda presented by a family of daimyo (Japanese feudal lord), the Mori clan.

The anecdote about 'Ranmaru MORI' shows similarities to stories about other people and classical literature, and so some point out that it is a fiction created after the Edo period as well as a propaganda presented by a family of daimyo (Japanese feudal lord), the Mori clan.
sen.cmt: 原文の「」に合せて"を'に訂正しました。
sen.e: The anecdote about 'Ranmaru MORI' shows similarities to stories about other people and classical literature, and so some point out that it is a fiction created after the Edo period as well as a propaganda presented by a family of daimyo (Japanese feudal lord), the Mori clan.

sen.j: 天正10年（1582年）、甲斐国武田氏滅亡後は、武田征伐に貢献したとして信濃国川中島に領地替えとなった長可に替わって美濃国金山城 (美濃国)の城主に任じられる。
sen.e: In 1582, after the fall of the Takeda clan of Kai Province, he was appointed to the lord of the Kaneyama-jo Castle in Mino Province, to take the place of Nagayoshi, who had been awarded a fief in Kawanakajima, Shinano Province, for his contribution to the conquest of the Takeda clan.
sen.cmt: 原文に美濃国が二度書かれているので、訳には省略しました。
sen.e: In 1582, after the fall of the Takeda clan of Kai Province, he was appointed to the lord of the Kaneyama-jo Castle in Mino Province, to take the place of Nagayoshi, who had been awarded a fief in Kawanakajima, Shinano Province, for his contribution to the conquest of the Takeda clan.
sen.cmt: 不要なスペースを削除しました。
sen.e: In 1582, after the fall of the Takeda clan of Kai Province, he was appointed to the lord of the Kaneyama-jo Castle in Mino Province, to take the place of Nagayoshi, who had been awarded a fief in Kawanakajima, Shinano Province, for his contribution to the conquest of the Takeda clan.

sen.j: 同年、本能寺の変で安田国継に討ち取られた。
sen.e: In the same year, he was killed by Kunitsugu YASUDA during the Honnoji Incident.
In the same year, he was killed by Kunitsugu YASUDA during the Honnoji Incident.
In the same year, he was killed by Kunitsugu YASUDA during the Honnoji Incident.

sen.j: 諱は『寛政重修諸家譜』に長定（ながさだ）とあり、他に長康とする説もあるが、活躍当時の文書で確認出来るのは成利である。
sen.e: His real name appears as Nagasada in "Kansei Choshu Shokafu" (Genealogies of Nobilities Compiled in Kansei Era), and while some say it is Nagayasu, Naritoshi is the only verifiable name in materials written during his days.

His real name appears as Nagasada in "Kansei Choshu Shokafu" (Genealogies of Nobilities Compiled in Kansei Era), and while some say it is Nagayasu, Naritoshi is the only verifiable name in materials written during his days.

His real name appears as Nagasada in "Kansei Choshu Shokafu" (Genealogies of Nobilities Compiled in Kansei Era), and while some say it is Nagayasu, Naritoshi is the only verifiable name in materials written during his days.

sen.j: また、幼名は蘭丸の名で流布しているが、当時の史料は全て乱、乱丸、乱法師と表記されており、「蘭」の文字は後世に創作的に充てられたものである。
sen.e: Also, even though his childhood name is widely known as 蘭丸(Ranmaru), it is written as 乱 (Ran), 乱丸 (Ranmaru), or 乱法師 (Ran Hoshi) in all of the historical materials from those days, indicating the letter "蘭" (Ran) was created in later generations.

Also, even though his childhood name is widely known as 蘭丸 (Ranmaru), it is written as 乱 (Ran), 乱丸 (Ranmaru), or 乱法師 (Ran Hoshi) in all of the historical materials from those days, indicating the letter '蘭' (Ran) was created in later generations.
sen.cmt: スペース補足しました。原文の「」に合せて"を'に訂正しました。
sen.e: Also, even though his childhood name is widely known as 蘭丸 (Ranmaru), it is written as 乱 (Ran), 乱丸 (Ranmaru), or 乱法師 (Ran Hoshi) in all of the historical materials from those days, indicating the letter '蘭' (Ran) was created in later generations.

sen.j: そのため、一般的に知れ渡っている森蘭丸の名と同じ様に呼ぶ場合は、森乱丸と表記する方が正しいと思われる。
sen.e: Therefore, even if we choose to use his widely-spread name, Ranmaru MORI, to call him, it is considered more accurate to write it as 森乱丸 than 森蘭丸.
Therefore, even if we choose to use his widely-spread name, Ranmaru MORI, to call him, it is considered more accurate to write it as 森乱丸 than 森蘭丸.
Therefore, even if we choose to use his widely-spread name, Ranmaru MORI, to call him, it is considered more accurate to write it as 森乱丸 than 森蘭丸.

sen.j: また、森蘭丸といえば、大抵のイメージでは女性のような美貌を持ち、涼やかな感じの美男子だったとして描かれる傾向がある。
sen.e: In addition, when Ranmaru MORI is mentioned, we usually imagine him as a clean, refreshing handsome man with feminine beauty.
In addition, when Ranmaru MORI is mentioned, we usually imagine him as a clean, refreshing handsome man with feminine beauty.
In addition, when Ranmaru MORI is mentioned, we usually imagine him as a clean, refreshing handsome man with feminine beauty.

sen.j: しかし、実際の森成利に関する容姿の記述は同時代の史料には存在せず、むしろどちらかと言うと、父や兄と同じく屈強な体格だったのでないかと考察される事がある。
sen.e: However, there is no historical materials that describe how Naritoshi MORI actually looked; rather, he is sometimes considered to have possessed a strong physique, like his father and brothers.
However, there is no historical materials that describe how Naritoshi MORI actually looked; rather, he is sometimes considered to have possessed a strong physique, like his father and brothers.
However, there is no historical materials that describe how Naritoshi MORI actually looked; rather, he is sometimes considered to have possessed a strong physique, like his father and brothers.

sen.j: 『決定版図説・戦国甲冑集』などには「森蘭丸の具足」とされる物が記載されているが、この具足は日本甲冑史学研究会会長の井伊達夫（当時中村達夫）が彦根で発見して川越の古美術商・奥平長良に譲ったものであり、両人とも名前を公表した上で「自分たちが発見、預かった品で（森蘭丸のものではなく）無名の鎧」とはっきりと森蘭丸の鎧であることを否定している。
sen.e: Some books such as "Sengoku Armor Collection Book" list what is considered a "Ranmaru MORI's armor", but the armor was discovered in Hikone City by the chairman of the Japanese Armor History Society, Tatsuo II (then Tatsuo NAKAMURA), who sold it to an antique dealer in Kawagoe City, Nagayoshi OKUHIRA, and upon official announcement of their names, the two men have flatly denied that the armor belonged to Ranmaru MORI, stating, "The armor was discovered and kept by us and is nameless (not Ranmaru MORI's)."

Some books such as "Sengoku Armor Collection Book" list what is considered a 'Ranmaru MORI's armor,' but the armor was discovered in Hikone City by the chairman of the Japanese Armor History Society, Tatsuo II (then Tatsuo NAKAMURA), who sold it to an antique dealer in Kawagoe City, Nagayoshi OKUHIRA, and upon official announcement of their names, the two men have flatly denied that the armor belonged to Ranmaru MORI, stating, 'the armor was discovered and kept by us and is nameless (not Ranmaru MORI's).'
sen.cmt: 原文の「」に合せて"を'に訂正しました。コンマの位置を訂正しました。不要なスペースを削除しました。the 小文字にしました。
sen.e: Some books such as "Sengoku Armor Collection Book" list what is considered a 'Ranmaru MORI's armor,' but the armor was discovered in Hikone City by the chairman of the Japanese Armor History Society, Tatsuo II (then Tatsuo NAKAMURA), who sold it to an antique dealer in Kawagoe City, Nagayoshi OKUHIRA, and upon official announcement of their names, the two men have flatly denied that the armor belonged to Ranmaru MORI, stating, 'the armor was discovered and kept by us and is nameless (not Ranmaru MORI's).'

sen.j: 井伊達夫は著書で「もう少しどこかに信憑性が欲しい」とまで述べており、この偽物を相当不快に思っているようである。
sen.e: "I would like more credibility somewhere," Tatsuo II even wrote in his book, seemingly quite unpleased of the forgery.
Tatsuo II even wrote that 'he would like more credibility somewhere' in his book, seemingly quite unpleased of the forgery.
sen.cmt: 原文の「」に合せて"を'に訂正しました。文章訂正しました。
sen.e: Tatsuo II even wrote that 'he would like more credibility somewhere' in his book, seemingly quite unpleased of the forgery.

sen.j: なお発見当時には前立などはなかったらしい。
sen.e: In addition, the armor was reportedly not found along with a crest or the like at the time of the discovery.
In addition, the armor was reportedly not found along with a crest or the like at the time of the discovery.
In addition, the armor was reportedly not found along with a crest or the like at the time of the discovery.

sen.j: どのような経緯で森蘭丸の具足とされるようになったのかは不明である。
sen.e: It is not clear how the armor became to be regarded as Ranmaru MORI's.
It is not clear how the armor became to be regarded as Ranmaru MORI's.
It is not clear how the armor became to be regarded as Ranmaru MORI's.

sen.j: 阿弥陀寺 (京都市上京区)
sen.e: Amida-ji Temple (Kamigyo-ku, Kyoto City)
Amida-ji Temple (Kamigyo Ward, Kyoto City)

sen.j: 可成寺
sen.e: Kajo-ji Temple
